intro: Echinocarpus erythrocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited burr, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant produces distinctive spiny, spherical fruits that are typically bright red when mature. These fruits contain seeds enclosed in a thick, fibrous husk. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
